basicInfo.notes: Founded in 2008 by Trey Gardner (CEO). Industry's leading eco-friendly web hosting provider. Puts 3x the energy consumed back into the grid as renewable energy via Bonneville Environmental Foundation. EPA Green Power Partner since 2009. Hosts 600,000+ websites. Up to 200 employees across 4 continents. HQ in Wilmington, Delaware with operations in Los Angeles, California.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: Domain registrations non-refundable; SSL certificates non-refundable; Migration services non-refundable; Must cancel 5+ days before renewal date

securitySsl.sslProvider: Let's Encrypt (AlphaSSL free on Premium plan)

policiesOverages.bandwidthOveragePolicy: Unmetered within fair use; no overage fees charged
policiesOverages.storageOveragePolicy: Hard limits apply; must upgrade plan
policiesOverages.accountSuspensionPolicy: Fair use policy violations may result in suspension; resource abuse affecting other users prohibited
policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Exceeding inode limits (150K-500K depending on plan); excessive resource usage affecting other users on shared server
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: Renewal prices ~4x higher than promo ($2.95 → $12.95); $25 fee for manual backup restores (1 free per month); On-demand backups only on Pro/Premium plans; Dedicated IP only free on Premium plan; Auto-renewal complaints common; Phone support not 24/7 (9AM-12AM EST)

editorial.knownIssues: Renewal prices ~4x higher than promo ($2.95 → $12.95); No dedicated server hosting; Phone support not 24/7 (closes at midnight EST); $25 backup restore fee after 1 free monthly; On-demand backups only on Pro/Premium; Auto-renewal complaints on BBB; Not BBB Accredited; English-only support; No cloud hosting option
editorial.bestFor: Eco-conscious users (3x renewable energy offset); WordPress users needing LiteSpeed; Users wanting cPanel; International users (6 data center locations including Canada); Users who value green hosting credentials; WooCommerce stores (LiteSpeed optimized)
editorial.avoidIf: Need dedicated servers; Need 24/7 phone support; Budget-conscious at renewal time (4x markup); Need enterprise compliance; Non-English speakers; Need cloud hosting
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: Unique 3x renewable energy offset (EPA certified since 2009); LiteSpeed included (like Hostinger, unlike SiteGround); 6 data center locations (more than HostGator, fewer than Hostinger); cPanel included (unlike Hostinger hPanel); Similar renewal markup to competitors (4x vs 4-6x); MariaDB instead of MySQL; Lower Trustpilot review count than competitors; Nightly backups standard (better than HostGator weekly); Not BBB Accredited (like Namecheap D-)

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: Industry's greenest host putting 3x energy back as renewable, with LiteSpeed and cPanel
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Eco-conscious blogger or small business wanting green credentials with modern performance

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: GreenGeeks is excellent for eco-conscious users wanting green hosting with LiteSpeed performance, but has no dedicated servers and limited phone support hours.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: GreenGeeks is privately owned, founded in 2008 by Trey Gardner (CEO). EPA Green Power Partner since 2009.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: GreenGeeks shared hosting starts at $2.95/month (promo) and renews at $12.95/month. First year costs approximately $35.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: Yes, GreenGeeks offers cPanel, free migration, and good support, making it beginner-friendly with eco-friendly appeal.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: Yes, GreenGeeks includes 50 email accounts with shared hosting plans.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Yes, GreenGeeks offers optimized WordPress hosting with LiteSpeed cache, staging (Pro+), and nightly backups.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: GreenGeeks guarantees 99.9% uptime with SLA credits for downtime.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Yes, with a 30-day money-back guarantee. Domains, SSL certificates, and migration services are non-refundable.
